Articles.Content:
So im just looking for a bit of clarification, or a why.  I've noticed while docking if you switch to your target vehicle and use its SAS to point at your docking ship and switch back to to the docking ship,  your target vehicle will orientate itself to it and even follow it.  but if you switch back to the target again for any reason, its SAS will reset to "stability assist"  instead of staying on "target" mode like it was, even tho it was following just fine while not controlling that ship.

is there a reason its like this?  and is there any way to make it just stay on "target"  like it was so i dont have to switch it if i go back to the target for any reason? lol  

now this was with level 5 pilots,  would probes act the same way? i havent had a chance to check that yet

Usually when I leave the target vehicle SAS on target mode, it starts rotating wildly rather than following the active ship.  So I've had to use hold instead by necessity.  Interesting you get any good results from target mode.

9 minutes ago, Aegolius13 said:

Usually when I leave the target vehicle SAS on target mode, it starts rotating wildly rather than following the active ship.  So I've had to use hold instead by necessity.  Interesting you get any good results from target mode.

maybe its probes vs manned?  cause i always get good results with selecting target, so long as the target isnt using any rcs thrusters since they can cause issues if they arent centered properly.

before i posted this i tested it with really small docking pods, and my target would follow me as i floated around it in circles,  cause i wanted to make sure i wasnt wrong about it doing it lol

1 minute ago, DD_bwest said:

maybe its probes vs manned?  cause i always get good results with selecting target, so long as the target isnt using any rcs thrusters since they can cause issues if they arent centered properly.

before i posted this i tested it with really small docking pods, and my target would follow me as i floated around it in circles,  cause i wanted to make sure i wasnt wrong about it doing it lol

I think I've seen it with both probes and manned.  But mostly when docking at bigger stations.  I suspect the physics might be overloading the computer, or it's having trouble coordinating the reaction wheels in the station and the other various docked craft.

2 hours ago, DD_bwest said:

is there a reason its like this?  and is there any way to make it just stay on "target"  like it was so i dont have to switch it if i go back to the target for any reason? lol  

now this was with level 5 pilots,  would probes act the same way? i havent had a chance to check that yet

I don't know the reason, but the results are indeed ... um... variable.

When it works (and it sometimes works for me, like you describe) it is the same whether a pilot or advanced probe core: it stays tracking when you switch away, but reverts to stability assist if you switch back. The trouble is that ships are so prone to "forgetting" their target at the best of times that I rarely even consider using the possibility.

Still, that may explain why it reverts to stability assist: if the existence of the target is something that the game doesn't recognise immediately (or at all) when you take control of a vessel, then reverting to stability assist is a default behaviour.

hmm okay.  i guess it could be related to forgetting a target.  i generally have really good luck with it, iv even able to dock while in map view lol

ive seen it fail to do it before, but i don't remember the circumstances that was under so i wouldnt know how to duplicate it.
